I find that this card struggles quite a bit to do either job well. The damage just isn’t very high, and the cost reduction being totally random makes it fairly unrewarding, and can also makes deciding which cards to play very difficult. Dead-on is easiest to trigger when you have already played out most of your hand, or when you are drawing cards into your hand, thus enabling those already on the far-right side. In both situations the cost reduction is going to be either low impact, or very random. It’s only slightly better than iron wave (and is conditional) if it hits a basic defend, and the damage isn’t that good if it hits a basic strike. Not being able to choose what gets reduced may also lead to situations where you really need to block/attack/scale, but you can’t. 

The upgrade is particularly weird to me, as it increases the cost reduction to 2, which just doubles down on the variance. Now you really want to have expensive cards to reduce the cost of, but that makes it harder to trigger dead-on in the first place, and it makes reducing the wrong card with itchy trigger feel even worse. Enervate and called shot both do a much better job of letting you play a cheap attack, and really outperform this card in most situations. Having the 4th energy makes the condition easier to meet, but also means that you will need the cost reduction less.

I used to be more defensive of this card because I would think a 0 cost damage common can't be that bad, but this is like a 0.5 cost damage common on the lower end of damage that scales to like 0.25 cost. I think their purposes are similar. Itchy trigger finger is supposed to be "free" damage since with its dead on effect you reduce another card(s) cost by 1 which makes up for the energy you payed. Called shot also does free damage with dead on, although its acutally free (making it far more reliable), has retain and most importantly draws you a card (this adds a lot of value and is what makes called shot truly free damage most of the time)

the advantage ichy trigger has is that with its upgrade it saves 2 energy instead of one, assuming it hits 2 cards and it hits 2 cards that are able to be played and have valuable effects when you do so (like if you hand has a defend, glare and itchy trigger then you miss out since glare cannot cost less then 0). Theres a lot of ifs for it to be slightly stronger then the far more consistent called shot (as well as enervate)
I guess, but they go about it at very different ways to tbh I don't really see it.

from a deck building perspective, you would want to draft one of those 3 cards for similar reasons; the schematics might make you favor one over another (and I think itchy trigger is not strong enough to choose over the other choices)
like having some "free" damage can go a long way if your deck is using <deadeye> and combo to scale
